title: Author Correction: Endocytosis in the axon initial segment maintains neuronal polarity

Südhof  ORCID: orcid.org/0000-0003-3361-92755,6, Robert Malenka  ORCID: orcid.org/0000-0002-5428-52117, Marius Wernig  ORCID: orcid.org/0000-0002-5309-515X2,3, Engin Özkan  ORCID: orcid.org/0000-0002-0263-67298,9, David Perrais  ORCID: orcid.org/0000-0002-5878-54084 & …Kang Shen  ORCID: orcid.org/0000-0003-4059-82491  Nature (2025)Cite this article Subjects Correction to: Nature https://doi.org/10.1038/s41586-022-05074-5 Published online 17 August 2022In the version of the article initially published, Fig. 3j and Extended Data Fig. 5a contained errors that were generated during figure assembly. In both cases, the initially published accompanying source data file contains the correct data. None of the paper’s interpretations are affected by this correction.Figure 3j contained an error in the lrpl-1(lof) lrp2(lof) mutant data, which were mistakenly graphed and inadvertently duplicated from the overexpressed DMA-1 condition of Fig. 1p. This error only pertains to the lrpl-1(lof) lrp2(lof) mutant data. Data for wild type and degt-1(lof) were intentionally re-graphed between Fig. 1p and Fig. 3j as specified in the published Fig. 3 legend. The corrected graph is shown below in Fig. 1, together with the incorrect published graph, for transparency to the readers. This error did not affect any conclusions because the source data were correct, and the mistaken bar graph in question was from a mutant phenotype with a very similar defect (76.67% vs 78.33% of animals responding).Fig. 1: Original and corrected Fig. 3j.Full size imageExtended Data Fig. 5a contained an incorrect display micrograph for the DMA-1(ΔYFGI) mutant. This error occurred during figure assembly, and the corresponding quantification and raw data for this experiment, which are graphed in Extended Data Fig. 5b, are correct. The corrected figure panel is shown below in Fig. 2, together with the incorrect published display panel, for transparency to the readers. Nature (2025)Cite this article

Subjects

Correction to: Nature https://doi.org/10.1038/s41586-022-05074-5 Published online 17 August 2022

In the version of the article initially published, Fig. 3j and Extended Data Fig. 5a contained errors that were generated during figure assembly. In both cases, the initially published accompanying source data file contains the correct data. None of the paper’s interpretations are affected by this correction.

Figure 3j contained an error in the lrpl-1(lof) lrp2(lof) mutant data, which were mistakenly graphed and inadvertently duplicated from the overexpressed DMA-1 condition of Fig. 1p. This error only pertains to the lrpl-1(lof) lrp2(lof) mutant data. Data for wild type and degt-1(lof) were intentionally re-graphed between Fig. 1p and Fig. 3j as specified in the published Fig. 3 legend. The corrected graph is shown below in Fig. 1, together with the incorrect published graph, for transparency to the readers. This error did not affect any conclusions because the source data were correct, and the mistaken bar graph in question was from a mutant phenotype with a very similar defect (76.67% vs 78.33% of animals responding).

Extended Data Fig. 5a contained an incorrect display micrograph for the DMA-1(ΔYFGI) mutant. This error occurred during figure assembly, and the corresponding quantification and raw data for this experiment, which are graphed in Extended Data Fig. 5b, are correct. The corrected figure panel is shown below in Fig. 2, together with the incorrect published display panel, for transparency to the readers. This error did not affect any conclusions because the source data were correct, and the mistaken display panel was from a statistically indistinguishable genotype.
